required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Lutein Supplementation on Cognition and MPOD in Multiple Sclerosis Patients-
clinical_study.official_title: Lutein and Multiple Sclerosis Experimental Study (LuMES)

collaborator.agency: Division of Nutritional Sciences, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
National Institutes of Health Rehabilitation Research Resource to Enhance Clinical Trials (REACT)

brief_summary.textblock: The central hypothesis is that lutein supplementation will improve MPOD and cognition. Accordingly, the specific aims are to 1) to determine the process feasibility associated with participating in 4-month lutein supplementation trial; and 2) to investigate the scientific feasibility of 4-month daily lutein supplementation on biological markers of lutein status and cognitive function among persons with MS.

detailed_description.textblock: A two-group parallel design will be employed whereby participants will be randomly assigned to one of 2 groups. The supplementation doses 20mg/d (Group 1), and placebo (Group 2) will be consumed daily by the participant for a 4-month period. Pre-test and follow-up measures of lutein status and cognitive function will be assessed at baseline and at 4-month follow-up via laboratory visits.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A 2-group parallel design will be employed to collect feasibility data on daily lutein supplementation over 4 months.

primary_outcome.description: Changes in Macular Pigment Optical Density (log units) between groups using a macular densitometer
Changes in accuracy (%) between groups using a computerized flanker task
Changes in reaction time (ms) between groups using a computerized flanker task
Changes in P3 event related potential amplitude (microvolts) between groups using a computerized flanker task
Changes in P3 event related potential latency (ms) between groups using a computerized flanker task

intervention.description: Participants will consume daily soft gels containing the lutein supplement.
Participants will consume daily soft gels containing the safflower oil.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-64.9 years
- Self-reported relapsing-remitting MS (RRMS) diagnosis
- Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS) score between 0-3.5
- Macular Pigment Optical Density at baseline (MPOD ≤0.35)
- Score ≤55 during the Symbol Digit Modalities Test (SDMT)
- 20/20 or corrected vision
- No presence of color blindness
- No history of age-related macular degeneration
- No history of epileptic seizures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under 18 years or over 64.9 years
- MS diagnosis other than RRMS
- Pregnancy
- Uncorrected vision
- Presence of color blindness
- PDDS score of 7 or more
- Prior diagnosis of age-related macular degeneration
- History of epileptic seizures
